document.docAuthor: Saether, Ole A. & Oyewo, Emmanuel Adeoye
document.masterDocTitle: Keys, phylogenies and biogeography of Polypedilum subgenus Uresipedilum Oyewo et Saether (Diptera, Chironomidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Keys, phylogenies and biogeography of Polypedilum subgenus Uresipedilum Oyewo et Saether (Diptera, Chironomidae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type species:
Chironomus convictus
Walker, 1856
: 161
[
= Polypedilum convictum
].

Diagnostic characters and a complete diagnosis of all stages are given by
Oyewo and Saether ( 1998 )
. The included species with listing of known life stages, distribution and references are:

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:

Oyewo et Saether, 1998
: 347
. Male. Ghana .

: 594
. Male. Micronesia .

: 22
. Male. South Africa (
Freeman 1958 : 295 , pro parte , not
P. (P.)
annulatum

: 295
, pro parte (=
P. (U.) praegnans Oyewo et Saether
and
P . (U.) harrisoni Oyewo et Saether
), not
P. (P.) annulatum
Harrison, 1996
: 78
(=
P. (U.) harrisoni Oyewo et Saether
)).

: 61

;

subSubSection.paragraph:
Notes: The adults of
P. (U.) flavum
and
P. (U.) convictum
are very similar, leading
Townes ( 1945 )
to erroneously synonymize the two. The immature stages of the two species are quite different. It is not known if the true
P. (U.) convictum
occurs in North America or
P. (U.) flavum
in Europe.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Polypedilum japonicum
Tokunaga, 1938
: 333
, from Japan has been placed in
Uresipedilum
by
Makarchenko et al. ( 2000 )
. It belongs, however, to the subgenus
Tripodura
.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Bidawid-Kafka ( 1996 )
described 3
Polypedilum
species from Brazil with strong wing markings,
P. s a l a - voni, P. sabbuhi ,
and P. s a l w i t i , which could belong to
Uresipedilum
. However, in addition to the wing markings the projection of the superior volsella apparently is placed apically or apicolateral, not apicomedian as in other species of
Uresipedilum
. The species appear better placed in
Tripodura
or in the apparently polyphyletic
Polypedilum s. str
.
